{"step_by_step_thinking": "The TNM Staging system is a classification system used to stage cancers. It's based on the size of the tumor (T), the extent of lymph node involvement (N), and the presence of distant metastasis (M). This system does not measure anything, it just classifies and categorizes. Therefore, it cannot be considered as any type of scale that measures quantities or values. It is a categorical classification system.", "answer_choice": "C"}
